result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert E Howard was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 3 days granted.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Not to use or possess of CBD products.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Remaining bail applied. Balance to be paid from prison wages and as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS. PAID IN FULL
Blood costs to be forwarded to the City of Brookfield Police Dept.

supervisions.notes: 10-08-19 COURT AMENDED EXTENDED SUPERVISION SENTENCE FROM 5 YEARS TO 3 YEARS.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Follow through with AODA Assessment and attend Victim Impact Panel Meeting during Extended Supervision.

09:16 AM Defendant Robert E Howard in court with attorney Andrew Mishlove.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, supervised by Attorney Brian Juech, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.  Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statements by Mike D., Laurie H., Robert H., and John W.  Statement by defendant.  

  The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:
7 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 3 days )
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	5 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No Use or Possession of CBD products;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription

FINE:  $ 9439.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  City of Brookfield Police Department.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining fine/surcharge/fees to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 

AODA Assessment and follow through

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
